item.title: Detecting Mixed Layer Depth with Optimal Linear fitting method.
item.description: Introduction The mixed layer is a thin layer with constant temperature and salinity from the surface down to a depth where the values differ from those at the surface (Boyer Mont√©gut et al. 2004). Wind blowing on the ocean stirs the upper layers leading to a thin mixed layer (Stewart 2008). The resulting surface mixed layer is important for local primary production, climate and ocean circulation (Kelley 2018). Although the mixed layer is an important oceanographic parameter, there different approaches that are used and each method depends on the scientific application.
